channel.title: Anyone ever gotten featured on Electronic Gems?
channel.description: Wondering if anyone on here has ever managed to get one of their tracks featured on any popular YouTube channels like Electronic Gems, MrSuicideSheep, or any other music channels that accept submissions/suggestions. If so, please leave some tips or links to channels that I and others might not be aware of!

item.title: Anyone ever gotten featured on Electronic Gems?
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Recently got onto heroboard, 176k subs

https://www.youtube.com/embed/QBDcgC5Y9E0

I was looking for a label to release this song on, and they accepted it.
There‚Äôs no real tips or tricks other than submit to channels that use your genre. Heroboard is pretty genreless, really on the chiller side of the music spectrum. They‚Äôre also pretty good because they provide graphics, mastering, and distribution.

item.title: Anyone ever gotten featured on Electronic Gems?
item.dc:creator: stereofield
item.description:
Got on Fluidified (383,000 subs)

ft. @crystldawnmusic

https://www.youtube.com/embed/SrKRlae835k

Edit: looks like you are looking for channels that accept submissions. Fluidified does but they never respond to any of mine (the one that got uploaded wasn‚Äôt submitted, they just uploaded it), so it might be a waste of time. I would recommend submitting to LUNCH BOX, they‚Äôre not very big but they‚Äôre better than a lot of music channels that I know of.
